page.title: 13THE PITS
page.content: {(A)THE PITS:}THERE ARE TWO TYPES OF PITS,ONE WHERE RUBBISH IS DUMPED WHICH WAS DUG RECENTLY AND THE GAULT CLAY FROM IT WAS USED TO BUILD THE A45 AND ITS INTERCHANGES.THE OTHER PITS HAD GRAVEL EXTRACTED FROM THEM IN THE 1930's TO HELP BUILD AIRSTRIPS ON THE NUMEROUS AIRFIELDS.THEY ARE NOW USED FOR LEISURE e.g TO FISH,SWIM,SAIL,OR JUST WALK,AND ENJOY THE ABUNDANCE OF WILDLIFE THEY HAVE ATTRACTED.{ {(B)TOMKIN'S MEAD:}THIS IS A NATURE RESERVE OF APROXIMATLY 4 ACRES.MUCH OF IT IS MARSHY LAND,WHERE RARE MARSH ORCHID GROWS.FORTY DIFFERENT SPECIES OF BIRDS HAVE BEEN RECORDED,SNAKES AND DEER ALSO LIVE THERE.CUBS HAVE ASSISTED IN FIXING BIRD BOXES TO SOME OF THE TREES.DIFFERENT SIZED BOXES ARE PUT UP TO ENCOURAGE OWLS AND TITS.
